title: Farmers lose more than £800m after hottest spring and summer on record, study finds
description: Crop production this year was hit by the hottest spring and summer on record, including some drought conditions, leaving farmers with 20% less revenue, according to an estimate by the Energy and Climate Intelligence Unit (ECIU) thinktank.
content:
British arable farmers are facing a revenue loss of more than £800m after one of the worst-ever harvests on record, analysis shows.
